title: Need advice/hint: a nice match for a font?
content:
Hello

I am looking for an advice, or just your opinion:  
I use the font "Flexo" ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/durotype/flexo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820022848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/durotype/flexo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/durotype/flexo/") ) for all of my business-stuff (print and online), but I'm not completely satisfied with my online-pages look.

It's there: [http://davidbraun.ch](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820022848/http:/davidbraun.ch/ "http://davidbraun.ch") and [http://davidbraun.ch/werkstatt](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820022848/http:/davidbraun.ch/werkstatt "http://davidbraun.ch/werkstatt")

Should I use a different font for the headlines? or rather the body? (My feeling is that flexo is better kept small...)  
What would you recommend?  
I once was very tempted to use emigre's vendetta, but my designer steered me away of this...  
And a bit later, I stumbled upon a font that was looking very much like flex, but it was a font of its own, and it had an italic-variant... (but totally cannot remember what it was...)

Thanks very much for your time and insights

david
